value.title: DAX Fridays! #194: COVID Tracker Part2: Modeling and getting the last value of an accumulated list
value.excerpt: In part 2 of the creation of the covid vaccine tracker, we are going to model the data we imported in part 1 (see link below) and create the most difficult calculation: The sum of the values from the last date that is not blank.  Chapters: 00:00 Intro 00:55 Show the data 02:00 Model the data 03:30 Explain

value.title: DAX Fridays #195: 🔥 53 DAX Best Practices 🔥
value.excerpt: In this video we are going to cover 53 (!) DAX / Power BI best practices. value.title: DAX Fridays! #31: Rounding Time, Prices and Numbers with DAX
value.excerpt: In today’s DAX Fridays video I will show you how to round time, prices and numbers using ROUND, ROUNDUP, ROUNDDOWN, INT, TRUNC, ODD, EVEN, MROUND, FLOOR and CEILING.  Rounding numbers, time and prices is a very useful skill as it will give you more control of your dataset and the accurancy in which your

value.title: DAX Fridays! #32: FORMAT
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through FORMAT function in DAX. We will learn how to use pre-formated functions and custom functions to format numbers and dates using DAX. value.title: DAX Fridays! #35: VALUES

value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/
